uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.request

Class AddCacheRequest<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.service.request.Request
      • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.request.CacheRequest
        • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.request.AddCacheRequest<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of object being cached

    public class AddCacheRequest<V>
extends CacheRequest
    This class represents requests for things to be added to the cache.

    All methods in this class throw NullPointerException if parameters are unset.

    • Method Detail

      • timeToLive

        public AddCacheRequest timeToLive(long ttlMillis)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry in milliseconds. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this amount of time.
        Parameters:
        ttlMillis - milliseconds for this entry to stay in the cache
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ttlMillis is negative

      • timeToLive

        public AddCacheRequest timeToLive(Temporal expiryPoint)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this point in time.
        Parameters:
        expiryPoint - the time point after which this entry should expire
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the expiry point is before now

      • timeToLive

        public AddCacheRequest timeToLive(Optional<Duration> timeToLive)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this amount of time. An empty Optional means the time to live is infinite.
        Parameters:
        timeToLive - the duration this should be alive in the cache
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a negative duration is specified

      • getTimeToLive

        public Optional<Duration> getTimeToLive()
        Get the length of time this entry should be alive in the cache.
        Returns:
        the time to live

      • setTimeToLive

        public void setTimeToLive(Optional<Duration> timeToLive)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this amount of time. An empty Optional means the time to live is infinite.
        Parameters:
        timeToLive - the duration this should be alive in the cache
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a negative duration is specified

      • setTimeToLive

        public void setTimeToLive(long ttlMillis)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry in milliseconds. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this amount of time.
        Parameters:
        ttlMillis - milliseconds for this entry to stay in the cache
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ttlMillis is negative

      • setTimeToLive

        public void setTimeToLive(Temporal expiryPoint)
        Set the time to live for this cache entry. If the cache supports time to live, it will be automatically expired after this point in time.
        Parameters:
        expiryPoint - the time point after which this entry should expire
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the expiry point is before now
